programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: For the four LAPD cops who beat Rodney King with batons, it may have been business as usual; but then the world learned that it had been captured on video, and those 81 seconds changed everything.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: When Charlie Manson and members of his family were given the death penalty for the Helter Skelter murders, people thought their reign of terror was over, but then California overturned the death penalty, making parole an option.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Gina and Sunny Han's rivalry was so intense it led to a murder plot and trial filled with twists and turns that have to be seen to be believed.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Just weeks after a jury found four LAPD officers innocent of brutally beating Rodney King, the LAPD was once again put in the spotlight for all the wrong reasons.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.sub-title: Sixth Amendment Violations and Other Accusations
programme.desc: Darrell Brooks lamented to the court that his sixth amendment rights have been violated among other things, as he represented himself in the deadly parade crash trial. He had a long commentary going on to the judge, without the jury there.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: The judge addresses the claims Darrell Brooks makes after his rant; Brooks is accused of ramming his car into a Christmas parade killing six people and injuring 61 others.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: According to the two medical examiners who worked the case, all six victims who died had injuries that included blunt force trauma and lacerations to the head, chest and internal organs.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: A local priest takes the stand. He was part of the Catholic Communities of Waukesha, a group that walked in the parade. Nineteen members were injured. In the end, six people died that day.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Police testify that approximately 67 police units worked security during the parade; the police detective, who was not on duty at the time of the crash, marched with the Catholic Communities of Waukesha.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: A police officer got emotional when testifying about the moment a SUV hit his family injuring two of his kids during the deadly parade crash.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: Darrell Brooks wasn't done with his cross-examination of a police detective who was off-duty and marching in the Christmas parade before the crash.

programme.title: Deadly Parade Crash Trial
programme.desc: The judge repeatedly asked the defendant to stop talking and not interrupt with irrelevant points. This was at the start of a new day of this trial, where he faced 76 felony charges that included those connected to the deaths of six people.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury finds Kit Martin guilty of murdering Calvin Phillips, Calvin's wife Pamela, and Edward Dansereau; he is also convicted of burglary, arson, tampering with evidence, and criminal attempt to commit arson.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: More emotional testimony in Kit Martin's punishment phase comes from the son who lost both his parents in this murder case; Kit is convicted of all charges, including triple murder.

programme.title: Pilot Triple Murder Trial
programme.desc: Closing arguments begin in the sentencing phase for Kit, who has been convicted of killing three neighbors; the victims' children give emotional testimony; the jury decides on Martin's punishment; the judge makes the final decision in this trial.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Opening statement was graphic and detailed on how Jennifer Fulford was kidnapped and later murdered. Stand accused and facing the death penalty in his alleged role in her death was the defendant - Scott Nelson.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jennifer Fulford's boss testified for prosecutors. She was a nanny for this real estate investor's two children. Next, the State brought in a police officer who worked early in this homicide case.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: A missing person's case was how the detective on the stand told jurors about Jennifer Fulford's disappearance.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors call in a forensic scientist from a California state criminal lab; Karen Read's defense claims that a dog was responsible for some of the injuries that John O'Keefe sustained.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The forensic scientist concludes that she found DNA from a pig on samples taken from John O'Keefe's shirt; she was initially looking for dog DNA since the defense blamed a dog for some of his injuries.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: More Details in the Albert Family Driveway
programme.desc: Prosecutors bring in everyone who was at the party at the Albert home hours before discovering John O'Keefe on the lawn; jurors listen to more observations from Ryan Nagel, who was at the scene hours before O'Keefe appeared in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors accusing Karen Read of murdering her boyfriend, John O'Keefe, call in witnesses who claim saw her SUV at the Albert family home; this was just hours before the discovery of the victim on the front lawn.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Eyewitnesses who said they saw the defendant's black SUV at the Albert family home recall what they noticed about the vehicle and the driver; prosecutors believe she intentionally hit John O'Keefe with her car.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The daughter of a friend of Karen Read testifies about what she remembered before and after John O'Keefe died; she is the daughter of Jennifer McCabe, who was with Karen at the scene.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Emotions ran high in the days following the Nov. 11, 2001 attack on the U.S.; for the most part, the grief and anger brought people together but for Frank Roque, it was a motivation for killing an innocent immigrant chasing the American dream.
